english_equivalent: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
description: Looks like a 'T' and can be found under the letter, makes a short 'u' sound (as in sun)

english_equivalent: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
description: Looks like a flat horizontal line under the letter and makes an 'ah' sound (as in darn)

english_equivalent: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
description: Two side-by-side dots under the letter, makes a long 'a' sound (as in say)

english_equivalent: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
description: Three dots arranged as an inverted pyramid under the letter, makes a short 'e' sound (as in red)

english_equivalent: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
description: Two dots stacked below the letter, can either have no sound at all (this is called a sheva nach) or it can make a quick 'ih' sound, as in lick (in which case it is called a sheva na)

english_equivalent: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
description: Can either make a long 'o' sound (as in lone), or among some Ashkenazim it makes an 'oy' (as in toy).

description: Makes an 'oo' sound (like boot) and appears like a vav with a dot to its left

description: A single dot below the letter, makes a long 'e' sound when followed by a yud. Otherwise it makes a short 'i' sound

Two dots stacked below the letter, can either have no sound at all (this is called a sheva nach) or it can make a quick 'ih' sound, as in lick (in which case it is called a sheva na)
Can either make a long 'o' sound (as in lone), or among some Ashkenazim it makes an 'oy' (as in toy).
Can either make a long 'o' sound (as in lone), or among some Ashkenazim it makes an 'oy' (as in toy).
Makes an 'oo' sound (like boot) and appears like a vav with a dot to its left
A single dot below the letter, makes a long 'e' sound when followed by a yud. Otherwise it makes a short 'i' sound
Looks like a 'T' and can be found under the letter, makes a short 'u' sound (as in sun)
Looks like a flat horizontal line under the letter and makes an 'ah' sound (as in darn)
Two side-by-side dots under the letter, makes a long 'a' sound (as in say)
Three dots arranged as an inverted pyramid under the letter, makes a short 'e' sound (as in red)
Two dots stacked below the letter, can either have no sound at all (this is called a sheva nach) or it can make a quick 'ih' sound, as in lick (in which case it is called a sheva na)
Can either make a long 'o' sound (as in lone), or among some Ashkenazim it makes an 'oy' (as in toy).
Can either make a long 'o' sound (as in lone), or among some Ashkenazim it makes an 'oy' (as in toy).
Makes an 'oo' sound (like boot) and appears like a vav with a dot to its left
A single dot below the letter, makes a long 'e' sound when followed by a yud. Otherwise it makes a short 'i' sound
Makes a shorter 'oo' sound like in 'book' and appears like three dots, arranged like an ascending staircase below the letter
